column4: So I'm about to install ubuntu on my laptop again. I have 4GB RAM and am wondering if I should go with the 64bit version instead of the 32 to be able to access the extra ~700MB of RAM. I won't be doint anything that requires that much RAM but being able to access it could be nice. Thoughts?
if you have a 64bit cpu, use the 64-bit version
I have a core2duo, so yeah it's 64bit - will there be any issues in so far as applications (especially media codecs) are concerned?
nothing i've noticed.  used to be a problem with flash, but it works fine here atm
